description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the Windows USB Hub Driver remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21429), ensure that your systems are updated with the required security patches:

1. Identify your Windows version and architecture (x64 or 32-bit).
2. Download the relevant KB Articles that address this vulnerability:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853).
   - For Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: [KB5035858](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035858).
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64: [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845).
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64: [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845).
3. Follow the installation instructions provided with the update.
4. Restart your system as needed to apply changes.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure administrative privileges are available for the updates.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.

**Details**:
This set of updates addresses a remote code execution vulnerability in the Windows USB Hub Driver that could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on affected installations. It is crucial to apply these updates promptly to mitigate risks associated with this vulnerability.
